result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krenston Arvell Watkins

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
JPTC adj from 10/20 to 11/9/22 @ 3pm due on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date

Defendant, Krenston Arvell Watkins, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am..   Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
